thread.title: STA Travel to judge ‘Young Brits’ contest
thread.title_full: STA Travel to judge ‘Young Brits’ contest

title: STA Travel to judge ‘Young Brits’ contest
text:
STA Travel to judge ‘Young Brits’ contest 17 July 2015 Save 
Agency chain STA Travel is teaming up with clothing brand Jack Wills in the search to find young people who have exhibited “extraordinary” achievements. 
The annual Jack Wills Young Brits contest to find eight people, aged from 16 to 25, who have shown “innovation, creativity, endurance and enterprise” in their specialist fields. 
The winners, who must be UK residents to enter, will receive £5,000 in funding as well as a mentoring programme from industry experts for a year. 
STA chief executive John Constable said: “I am really excited to be judging the endurance category of Young Brits for the second year. Last year, the standard of entries was incredibly high and I have great hopes for this year too. 
“Opportunities like this are so important to young people as we need to provide greater opportunities for them through internships and apprenticeships, so they can get ahead. 
“When I’m looking for young people to work for STA Travel, I look for individuals who are passionate about building long-lasting relationships with our customers.” 
Entries will be shortlisted by the public and nominations can be made until July 26. The eight Young Brits winners will be announced on October 1.
